alert.note: Alert for Northern Jasper; Northern Newton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 5:19PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Newton and east central Jasper Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 518 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over mainly rural areas of Jasper County moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newton, Kirbyville, Call, Bon Weir, Trout Creek, Roganville, Magnolia Springs, Old Salem, Mt. Union and Bleakwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
